text: us-british
love our custard and we've already done
a cup of recipes that include just that
you can see those there up until now
though we've always used the shop bought
products now this ready-made stuff is
great and certainly has its place but a
few of you in particular the silvery
dome and Katie have requested that I
show you how to make the homemade stuff
it is actually really simple though
there is a little bit of precision with
timing but I'm going to show you all the
steps so heat a pipe of milk into a
saucepan and bring up to the boil and
while that's warming through we're going
to scrape out the seeds in the vanilla
pod and add those into the milk to
infuse now for the eggs this is a bit
that's going to thicken the custard
we're two separate 6 large eggs it's
just the yolks we need today but I don't
mean slaves of white it's for another
day perhaps the meringue is or something
with these six egg yolks we now add the
same against at 6 teaspoons of castor
sugar and whisk them together now our
milk is boiling you can pour that over
the egg yolks whisking all the time now
tip the whole lot back into the pan and
stir over a gentle heat continuously
until it thickens they do this slowly so
you can see as it begins to thicken and
the consistency you're looking for is
one that sticks to the back of a spoon
so you can run your finger along the
spoon and it holds its shape but as soon
as you get to this thickness you have to
take it off the heat and pour it through
a sieve into a cold container and
that'll stop the cooking otherwise
you'll end up a sweet scrambled egg so
there is custard or creme anglaise ideal
served hot or cold I hope you got all
the details you need there Katie it's
homemade custard
sorted
[Music]
